Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc:
Instrument Overview =================== The SMASS survey was carried out using the Mark III spectrograph, equipped with a TI 4849 CCD (398 x 598 pixels) with a low-resolution grism (150 line.mm, blazed at 7300 A) to cover the wavelength range from 4000 to 10000 A in a single exposure, with a dispersion of ~10 A/pixel. A Wratten 12 filter (cutoff < 6000 A) was placed of the red spectral half of the CCD dewar window to block the second order spectral image.
Scientific Objectives ===================== The setup described above has the ability to image the entire spectrum in a single exposure and has many advantages over piecing together the different spectral regions from separate images. In particular, the effects resulting from the asteroid's rotational lightcurve can be neglected when the entire spectral range is imaged simultaneously.
